html.p: The visualization toolkit brings the power of Apache ECharts to Splunk Enterprise and Splunk Cloud. This tutorial will walk you through the basics of using the toolkit.
html.div:
Getting started
If you have not worked with ECharts before you find examples here. You will be able to integrate every of the show visualizations using your own data into Splunk. The example page also could be used as an IDE for customize your charts before bringing it to splunk.
create the first visualization
Let's open the very first example page. On the left side you see an option = "SomeJSON" string. This configures the visualization to the right. Try to play around with the data: attributes within xAxis and series.
Here is the basic skelleton for the custom visualization. Copy the code to your new dashboard.
<viz type="visualization_toolbox.hman"> <search> <query>| makeresults</query> <earliest>$earliest$</earliest> <latest>$latest$</latest> </search> <option name="visualization_toolbox.hman.dataType">Custom</option> <option name="visualization_toolbox.hman.option"> </option> <option name="height">300</option> <option name="refresh.display">progressbar</option> </viz>
In the next step copy your code from the ECharts example page wihtin the visualization_toolbox.hman.option tag.
<viz type="visualization_toolbox.hman"> <search> <query>| makeresults</query> <earliest>$earliest$</earliest> <latest>$latest$</latest> </search> <option name="visualization_toolbox.hman.dataType">Custom</option> <option name="visualization_toolbox.hman.option">option = { xAxis: { type: 'category', data: ['Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat', 'Sun'] }, yAxis: { type: 'value' }, series: [ { data: [150, 230, 224, 218, 135, 147, 260], type: 'line' } ] }; </option> <option name="height">300</option> <option name="refresh.display">progressbar</option> </viz>
html.p: this should show you your first visualization link in the panel below
